organization.fullName: Semmelweis University Heart and Vascular Center

identificationModule.briefTitle: Saline Flush to Reduce the Amount of Residual Air Inside a Stentgraft Delivery System
identificationModule.officialTitle: A Randomized Trial of an Increased Saline Flush Protocol to Reduce the Amount of Residual Air Inside a Stentgraft Delivery System

responsibleParty.investigatorAffiliation: Semmelweis University Heart and Vascular Center

leadSponsor.name: Semmelweis University Heart and Vascular Center

descriptionModule.briefSummary: Non-randomized studies have shown that de-airing of the delivery system with an increased volume of saline may be associated to a decrease in periprocedural stroke during thoracic endovascular aortic repair. This study is designed to provide evidence that 4xIFU-dose volume of saline flush vs. standard IFU-dose saline flush is associated to a decrease in the amount of intra-sac air detected on the first follow-up imaging after EVAR.

armGroups.label: 1xIFU
armGroups.description: Subjects in this arm are randomized to have a saline flush volume according to the IFU of the used device.

armGroups.label: 4xIFU
armGroups.description: Subjects in this arm are randomized to have a saline flush volume of 4x of what is stated in the IFU of the used device.

interventions.name: Increased saline flush volume
interventions.description: Additional flushing of the stentgraft delivery system.

primaryOutcomes.description: Total volume of air inside the aneurysm sac on discharge CT imaging.

eligibilityModule.eligibilityCriteria:
Inclusion Criteria:

* endovascular aortic repair of an abdominal aortic aneurysm using either of these devices: Terumo/Bolton Treo, Terumo Anaconda, Cook Zenith Alpha Abdominal

Exclusion Criteria:

* concomitant use of an iliac bifurcation device due to insufficient common iliac landing zone on either side

overallOfficials.name: Csaba Csobay-Novák, MD PhD
overallOfficials.affiliation: Dept. of Interventional Radiology, Heart and Vascular Center, Semmelweis University
